title: ArgumentError when calling Time methods with kwargs on an ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone in Ruby 3
body:
### Steps to reproduce
<!-- (Guidelines for creating a bug report are [available
here](https://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/contributing_to_ruby_on_rails.html#creating-a-bug-report)) -->
1. Extend Time with an instance method that takes keyword arguments
2. Call this method with keyword arguments on an instance of ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone

<!-- Paste your executable test case created from one of the scripts found [here](https://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/contributing_to_ruby_on_rails.html#create-an-executable-test-case) below: -->
```ruby
# frozen_string_literal: true

require "bundler/inline"

gemfile(true) do
  source "https://rubygems.org"

  git_source(:github) { |repo| "https://github.com/#{repo}.git" }

  gem "rails", github: "rails/rails", branch: "main"
end

require "active_support"
require "active_support/all"
require "minitest/autorun"

class Time
  def cool_format(coolness_factor: 1)
    strftime("%Y-%m-%d #{"ðŸ˜Ž" * coolness_factor}")
  end
end

class BugTest < Minitest::Test
  def test_time
    Time.now.cool_format(coolness_factor: 10)
  end

  def test_time_with_zone
    time = Time.now
    zone = ActiveSupport::TimeZone["Eastern Time (US & Canada)"]
    ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone.new(time, zone).cool_format(coolness_factor: 10)
  end
end
```

### Expected behavior
<!-- Tell us what should happen -->
ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone should successfully delegate methods to its underlying Time instance when calling a Time instance method on an ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone.

Per the example script:
```ruby
ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone.new(time, zone).cool_format(coolness_factor: 10)
# => "2023-03-03 ðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜Ž"
```

### Actual behavior
<!-- Tell us what happens instead -->
An ArgumentError is raised because [`method_missing` doesn't pass keyword arguments](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v7.0.4.2/activesupport/lib/active_support/time_with_zone.rb#L569-L570) in accordance with Ruby 3.

Per the example script:
```ruby
ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone.new(time, zone).cool_format(coolness_factor: 10)
# ArgumentError: wrong number of arguments (given 1, expected 0)
```

### System configuration
**Rails version**:
7.0.4.2 (although I first noticed this in 6.0.2.1)

**Ruby version**:
3.0.5 (I'd expect this behavior in any 3.x)
